name: Operators & Expressions
description: Understanding mathematical operators and how they are used in expressions.

cards.title: Order of Operations & PEMDAS
cards.description: Learning the correct sequence of operations in mathematical expressions.
bulletpoints: Apply the order of operations: \( P \rightarrow E \rightarrow MD \rightarrow AS \) (Parentheses, Exponents, Multiplication/Division, Addition/Subtraction)
Evaluate expressions step-by-step following the priority rules: \[ (3 + 5) \times 2 = 8 \times 2 = 16 \]
Understand the role of parentheses in overriding default precedence: \[ 3 + 5 \times 2 \neq (3 + 5) \times 2 \]
cards.summaryText: Practice PEMDAS sequencing, stepwise evaluation, and parentheses overrides.

cards.title: Exponents & Roots
cards.description: Understanding the rules governing exponents and radicals.
bulletpoints: Learn exponent laws: \( a^m \times a^n = a^{m+n} \), \( \frac{a^m}{a^n} = a^{m-n} \), \( (a^m)^n = a^{m \times n} \)
Convert between exponent and radical notation: \[ \sqrt[3]{8} = 8^{\frac{1}{3}} = 2 \]
Simplify expressions with exponents and roots: \[ (2^3)^2 = 2^6 = 64 \]
cards.summaryText: Reinforce exponent laws, radical conversions, and simplification patterns.

cards.title: Algebraic Expressions & Simplification
cards.description: Breaking down and simplifying algebraic expressions.
bulletpoints: Expand expressions using the distributive property: \[ a(b + c) = ab + ac \]
Factorize expressions by finding common factors: \[ x^2 - 5x = x(x - 5) \]
Combine like terms to simplify: \[ 3x + 5x - 2x = 6x \]
cards.summaryText: Apply distribution, factoring, and like-term combination to streamline algebra.

cards.title: Absolute Value & Number Line
cards.description: Understanding absolute value and its role in expressions.
bulletpoints: Interpret absolute value as the distance from zero: \[ |x| = \begin{cases} x, & x \geq 0 \\ -x, & x < 0 \end{cases} \]
Solve absolute value equations: \[ |x - 3| = 7 \Rightarrow x - 3 = 7 \text{ or } x - 3 = -7 \]
Graph absolute value functions: \[ y = |x| \] forms a V-shape on the coordinate plane
cards.summaryText: Interpret absolute value geometry, solve equations, and sketch V-shaped graphs.

cards.title: Logarithms & Exponential Relationships
cards.description: Understanding how logarithms relate to exponents.
bulletpoints: Define logarithms as the inverse of exponentiation: \[ \log_b(x) = y \Leftrightarrow b^y = x \]
Use logarithmic identities: \[ \log_b(xy) = \log_b x + \log_b y \]
Convert between logarithmic and exponential form: \[ 10^2 = 100 \Leftrightarrow \log_{10}(100) = 2 \]
cards.summaryText: Relate logs to exponents, leverage identities, and shift between forms.

cards.title: Modulus Operator & Remainders
cards.description: Using modulus to determine remainders in division.
bulletpoints: Define modulus operation: \[ a \mod b = r \text{ where } a = qb + r \text{ and } 0 \leq r < b \]
Example: \[ 17 \mod 5 = 2 \] because \( 17 = 5 \times 3 + 2 \)
Use modular arithmetic in number systems and cryptography
cards.summaryText: Understand mod remainders, compute examples, and note cryptographic uses.

cards.title: Solving & Graphing Inequalities
cards.description: Working with inequalities and their graphical representations.
bulletpoints: Solve linear inequalities and express them in interval notation: \[ x + 2 > 5 \Rightarrow x > 3 \Rightarrow (3, \infty) \]
Flip the inequality sign when multiplying or dividing by a negative number: \[ -3x > 9 \Rightarrow x < -3 \]
Graph compound inequalities on a number line
cards.summaryText: Solve inequalities, adjust for negatives, and graph solution intervals.

cards.title: Complex Numbers & Imaginary Unit
cards.description: Working with imaginary numbers and complex expressions.
bulletpoints: Define the imaginary unit: \[ i^2 = -1 \]
Perform operations with complex numbers: \[ (3 + 2i) + (1 - 4i) = 4 - 2i \]
Represent complex numbers on the complex plane
cards.summaryText: Review complex unit properties, arithmetic, and polar visualization.

cards.title: Summation Notation & Series
cards.description: Using sigma notation to represent sums.
bulletpoints: Use sigma notation to represent sums: \[ \sum_{k=1}^{n} k = \frac{n(n+1)}{2} \]
Compute arithmetic series: \[ S_n = \frac{n}{2} (a + l) \]
Evaluate geometric series using the formula: \[ S_n = \frac{a(1 - r^n)}{1 - r} \]
cards.summaryText: Interpret sigma notation and evaluate arithmetic and geometric series.

cards.title: Matrix Operations & Determinants
bulletpoints: Perform matrix multiplication: \[ A \times B = C \text{ where } C_{ij} = \sum_{k} A_{ik} B_{kj} \]
Compute determinants for 2x2 matrices: \[ \det(A) = ad - bc \text{ for } A = \begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix} \]
Apply inverse matrices to solve systems of equations
cards.summaryText: Practice matrix multiplication, determinant formulas, and inverse-based solving.
